div.p: 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 OR, An Appeal TO THE SCRIPTURES IN A Summary Collection of Scriptures, Produced, and Placed, in Answer to twenty one Questions, Relating to this following Enquiry.

VIZ. Whether the Seventh, or last day of the week, in the weekly Revolutions, and Returns of it, formerly was, now is, and till Heaven and Earth pass away, will be, the Divine Will, and Pleasure of Jehovah Elohim, to be Observed, and Celebrated, as a weekly Sabbath-day, according to the Prescription of infinite Wisdom; by Vertue of his holy Command, as the Duty of all Mankind, to their real and true benefit, and advantage, if observed, and to their deplorable misery if neglected.

LONDON, Printed in the Year 1676.

div.head: An Appeal to the Scriptures.
div.p: Quest. 1. Whether the ten words, commonly called the Moral Law, or D • calogue, formerly were, now are, and until Heaven and Earth do pass away, shall be, a Rule of Obedience, or not?
Answ, Isa. 8.20. To the Law and to the Testimony, if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.
M •• . 5.17. Think not that I am come to destroy the Law; I am not come to destroy but to fulfil.
Ver. 18. For verily I say unto you, till Heaven and Earth pass, one jott or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the Law till all be fulfilled.

Ver. 19. Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least Commandments, and shall teach men so he shall be called the least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whosoever shall do and teach them the same shall be called great in he Kingdom of Heaven.
Luke 16.17. And it is easier for Heaven and Faith to pass, then one tittle of the Law to fail.
Jam. 2.8. If ye fulfil the Royal Law according to the Scripture—ye do well.
Ver. 10. VVhosoever shall keep the whole Law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.
Ver. 11. For he that said, do not commit Adultery said also do not kill; Now if thou commit no adultery yet if thou kill thou art become a Transgressor of the Law.
Ver. 26. Faith without works is dead.
Rom. 3.31. Do we then make void the Law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the Law.
Rom. 7.7. Is the Law sin? God forbid nay, I had not known sin but by th • Law: for I had not known l • st, except the Law had said thou shalt not covet.
Ver. 12. Wherefore the Law is holy and the Commandment holy, and just and good,
Ver. 14. The Law is spiritual.
16. I consent unto the Law that it is good.
22. For I delight in the Law of God, after the inward man.
25. So then with my minde I my self serve the Law of God.
Pro. 28 4. They that forsake the Law praise the wicked: but such as keep the Law, contend with them.
Psal, 19.7. The Law of the Lord is perfect.
Eccl. 12.13. Let us hear the Conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God and keep his Commandments, for this is the whole Duty of man.
14. For God shall bring every work into Judgement, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil, Psal. 119. throughout, Jam. 1.25. 1 John 2 7. Jer. 7.28
